question.title: Unable to read a specific QR code in Java with ZXing or BoofCV
question.body:
Title

Java: Unable to decode a specific QR code with ZXing or BoofCV

Image

myQR

Body

Iâ€™m trying to decode a tricky QR code in Java, but neither ZXing nor BoofCV can read it correctly.

Minimal reproducible example

import com.google.zxing.*;
import com.google.zxing.client.j2se.BufferedImageLuminanceSource;
import com.google.zxing.common.HybridBinarizer;
import boofcv.io.image.ConvertBufferedImage;
import boofcv.struct.image.GrayU8;
import boofcv.factory.fiducial.ConfigQrCode;
import boofcv.abst.fiducial.QrCodeDetector;
import boofcv.struct.qrcode.QrCode;

import javax.imageio.ImageIO;
import java.awt.image.BufferedImage;
import java.io.File;
import java.util.List;

public class QRTest {
    public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
        BufferedImage img = ImageIO.read(new File("myQR.png"));

        // ZXing attempt
        try {
            Result result = new MultiFormatReader().decode(
                new BinaryBitmap(new HybridBinarizer(new BufferedImageLuminanceSource(img))));
            System.out.println("ZXing: " + result.getText());
        } catch (Exception e) {
            System.out.println("ZXing failed: " + e.getMessage());
        }

        // BoofCV attempt
        GrayU8 gray = ConvertBufferedImage.convertFromSingle(img, null, GrayU8.class);
        QrCodeDetector<GrayU8> detector = new QrCodeDetector<>(ConfigQrCode.defaultConfig());
        detector.process(gray);
        List<QrCode> codes = detector.getDetections();
        if(codes.isEmpty()[enter image description here]
            System.out.println("BoofCV failed to detect any QR codes.");
        else
            codes.forEach(qr -> System.out.println("BoofCV: " + qr.message));
    }
}

question_comments.body: I fixed it by creating a dedicated Java wrapper around ZBar.
The image in the link is a bit blurry, I can't scan it.
Yes! Also able to do it with pyzbar but not with Java libraries.
Can you read that QR code using your phone?
